ygData.subject: How to add objects
ygData.msgSnippet: Note: I am going to add my comments in a reply, since I have had trouble getting this message sent. **1st section of code** this subroutine adds objects on a

X-Yahoo-Profile: dph_of_rules

Note: I am going to add my comments in a reply, since I have had 
trouble getting this message sent.

**1st section of code**
'this subroutine adds objects on a wide scale
Dim intCount, intCounter, intCount2, intCount3, intCount4, intX, intY 
As Integer
Dim bitWidth As Byte
Dim strLine, strFileName, strFileName2 As String
Dim strTemp As String * 1

intCount4 = 0
'this variable is used to keep track of the number of objects added

Open strFileName For Binary As #1
Open strFileName2 For Binary As #2

'process the header information 1st
Get #1, 1, Filestruc.strHeader
Put #2, 1, Filestruc.strHeader
Get #1, 4, Filestruc.bitVersion
Put #2, 4, Filestruc.bitVersion
Get #1, 5, Filestruc.strGridName
Put #2, 5, Filestruc.strGridName
Get #1, 13, Filestruc.strScenTitle
Put #2, 13, Filestruc.strScenTitle
Get #1, 43, Filestruc.bitScenType
Put #2, 43, Filestruc.bitScenType
Get #1, 44, Filestruc.intParValue
Put #2, 44, Filestruc.intParValue
Get #1, 46, Filestruc.intObjectCount
Put #2, 46, Filestruc.intObjectCount
**end 1st section of code**

**2nd section of code**
ReDim strucThings(1 To Filestruc.intObjectCount) As Objectstruct
intCounter = 48
intCount3 = intCounter
'we are going to start adding some exits to the next scenario here
For intY = 1328 To 1360 Step 16
'I want the height to be 16 units apart
    For intX = 896 To 1072 Step 176
        'I want two columns
        Put #2, intCount3, CByte(2)
        'setting the order number as byte
        Put #2, intCount3 + 1, CByte(8)
        'setting the family number as byte
        Put #2, intCount3 + 2, CInt(intX)
        'setting the X position as an integer
        Put #2, intCount3 + 4, CInt(intY)
        'setting the Y position as an integer
        Put #2, intCount3 + 6, CByte(0)
        'setting the team number as an integer
        Put #2, intCount3 + 7, CByte(0)
        'setting the facing value as a byte
        Put #2, intCount3 + 8, CByte(2)
        'setting the command value as a byte
        Put #2, intCount3 + 9, CInt(165)
        'setting the level value as an integer
        Put #2, intCount3 + 11, ""
        'setting the objects name
        Put #2, intCount3 + 23, "MSTRMSTRMS"
        'setting the reserved value
        Filestruc.intObjectCount = Filestruc.intObjectCount + 1
        'increasing the object count
        Put #2, 46, Filestruc.intObjectCount
        'updating the object count to our new file
        intCount3 = intCount3 + 33
        'resetting the location on our new file
        intCount4 = intCount4 + 1
    Next intX
Next intY

intY = 1376
For intX = 896 To 1072 Step 16
'I want these 16 units apart
    Put #2, intCount3, CByte(2)
    'setting the order number as byte
    Put #2, intCount3 + 1, CByte(8)
    'setting the family number as byte
    Put #2, intCount3 + 2, CInt(intX)
    'setting the X position as an integer
    Put #2, intCount3 + 4, CInt(intY)
    'setting the Y position as an integer
    Put #2, intCount3 + 6, CByte(0)
    'setting the team number as an integer
    Put #2, intCount3 + 7, CByte(0)
    'setting the facing value as a byte
    Put #2, intCount3 + 8, CByte(2)
    'setting the command value as a byte
    Put #2, intCount3 + 9, CInt(163)
    'setting the level value as an integer
    Put #2, intCount3 + 11, ""
    'setting the objects name
    Put #2, intCount3 + 23, "MSTRMSTRMS"
    'setting the reserved value
    Filestruc.intObjectCount = Filestruc.intObjectCount + 1
    'increasing the object count
    Put #2, 46, Filestruc.intObjectCount
    'updating the object count to our new file
    intCount3 = intCount3 + 33
    'resetting the location on our new file
     intCount4 = intCount4 + 1
     'keeping track of the number of objects added
Next intX
**end 2nd section of code**

**3rd section of code**
'process the objects next
For intCount = 1 To (Filestruc.intObjectCount - intCount4)
'intObjectCount minus intCount4 equals the number of objects in the 
old file
'read the information first
    Get #1, intCounter, strucThings(intCount).bitOrder
    Get #1, intCounter + 1, strucThings(intCount).bitFamily
    Get #1, intCounter + 2, strucThings(intCount).intXpos
    Get #1, intCounter + 4, strucThings(intCount).intYpos
    Get #1, intCounter + 6, strucThings(intCount).bitTeam
    Get #1, intCounter + 7, strucThings(intCount).bitDirection
    Get #1, intCounter + 8, strucThings(intCount).bitCommand
    Get #1, intCounter + 9, strucThings(intCount).intLevel
    Get #1, intCounter + 11, strucThings(intCount).strName
    Get #1, intCounter + 23, strucThings(intCount).strReserved

    Put #2, intCount3, strucThings(intCount).bitOrder
    Put #2, intCount3 + 1, strucThings(intCount).bitFamily
    Put #2, intCount3 + 2, strucThings(intCount).intXpos
    Put #2, intCount3 + 4, strucThings(intCount).intYpos
    Put #2, intCount3 + 6, strucThings(intCount).bitTeam
    Put #2, intCount3 + 7, strucThings(intCount).bitDirection
    Put #2, intCount3 + 8, strucThings(intCount).bitCommand
    Put #2, intCount3 + 9, strucThings(intCount).intLevel
    Put #2, intCount3 + 11, strucThings(intCount).strName
    Put #2, intCount3 + 23, strucThings(intCount).strReserved
    
    intCount3 = intCount3 + 33
    'update the byte location on the old file
    intCounter = intCounter + 33
    'update the byte location on the new file
**end 3rd section of code**

**4th section of code**
    If ((strucThings(intCount).bitOrder = 5) And 
(strucThings(intCount).bitFamily = 0)) Then
    'I am placing exits to the previous scenario next to initial 
player positions
        Put #2, intCount3, CByte(2)
        'setting the order number as byte
        Put #2, intCount3 + 1, CByte(8)
        'setting the family number as byte
        Put #2, intCount3 + 2, CInt(strucThings(intCount).intXpos - 
16)
        'setting the X position as an integer
        Put #2, intCount3 + 4, CInt(strucThings(intCount).intYpos + 
16)
        'setting the Y position as an integer
        Put #2, intCount3 + 6, CByte(0)
        'setting the team number as an integer
        Put #2, intCount3 + 7, CByte(0)
        'setting the facing value as a byte
        Put #2, intCount3 + 8, CByte(2)
        'setting the command value as a byte
        Put #2, intCount3 + 9, CInt(163)
        'setting the level value as an integer
        Put #2, intCount3 + 11, ""
        'setting the objects name
        Put #2, intCount3 + 23, "MSTRMSTRMS"
        'setting the reserved value
        Filestruc.intObjectCount = Filestruc.intObjectCount + 1
        'increasing the object count
        Put #2, 46, Filestruc.intObjectCount
        'updating the object count to our new file
        intCount3 = intCount3 + 33
        'resetting the location on our new file
        intCount4 = intCount4 + 1
        'keeping track of the number of objects added
    End If
   
Next intCount
**end 4th section of code**

**5th section of code**
'read the number of text lines
Get #1, intCounter, Filestruc.bitTextLines
Put #2, intCount3, Filestruc.bitTextLines
'read the text lines
intCounter = intCounter + 1
intCount3 = intCount3 + 1
For intCount = 1 To Filestruc.bitTextLines
    'read the length of the line
    Get #1, intCounter, bitWidth
    Put #2, intCount3, bitWidth
    'read the text line
    For intCount2 = 1 To bitWidth
        Get #1, intCounter + intCount2, strTemp
        Put #2, intCount3 + intCount2, strTemp
    Next intCount2
    'update the byte number for both files
    intCounter = intCounter + 1 + bitWidth
    intCount3 = intCount3 + 1 + bitWidth
Next intCount
Close #2
Close #1
**end 5th section of code**
